New Records: India won by 302 runs, which is one of the largest victory margins in ODI history.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka was bowled out for 55 in 19.4 overs.
Dilshan Madushanka was caught by Shreyas Iyer off Ravindra Jadeja's bowling for 5 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: India aimed to seal a semi-final spot against struggling Sri Lanka.
India had won all their six matches prior to this game despite missing key players like Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya.
Sri Lanka entered the match with just four points from six games and were struggling to stay in the tournament.
India was without Hardik Pandya, who was expected to return for the final league match against the Netherlands.
Sri Lanka's captain Kusal Mendis struggled with his batting form since taking over the captaincy from Dasun Shanaka.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Wankhede pitch was expected to be high-scoring, with previous matches in the World Cup seeing scores of 399 and 382 by South Africa.
Virat Kohli was on the cusp of equalling Sachin Tendulkar's record of most ODI hundreds (48).
Kohli was also close to breaking another Tendulkar record for most 1000 ODI runs in a calendar year.
Shreyas Iyer needed 65 runs in his next three innings to become the third-fastest Indian to 2000 ODI runs.
Angelo Mathews had an excellent record against India, with an average of 53.57 and a strike rate of 84.93.
